about_the_game:
The Hypothesis on the Symmetry Between Vision and Hands is a peculiar game where you control the left and right hands with your own left and right hands. It’s a running action game where you simultaneously control the in-game right and left hands to reach the goal.

You’ll move, jump, and dash through stages, but controlling separate characters with each hand will likely frustrate you.

This game is about overcoming that frustration and enjoying the sense of accomplishment when you succeed.

In this demo, you can play through four stages.

Enjoy improving your skills as you progress through each stage.

Playtime

Approximately 30 minutes

You can quickly experience the core of the game.

Character Control [/h]

Keyboard

  • Change direction for left hand: WASD

  • Jump for left hand: F

  • Dash for left hand: C

  • Change direction for right hand: OKL;

  • Jump for right hand: J

  • Dash for right hand: M

  • Open menu: ESC

Gamepad (Xbox)

  • Change direction for left hand: Left stick

  • Jump for left hand: Left trigger

  • Dash for left hand: Left bumper

  • Change direction for right hand: Right stick

  • Jump for right hand: Right trigger

  • Dash for right hand: Right bumper

  • Open menu: Y

detailed_description:
The Hypothesis on the Symmetry Between Vision and Hands is a peculiar game where you control the left and right hands with your own left and right hands. It’s a running action game where you simultaneously control the in-game right and left hands to reach the goal.

You’ll move, jump, and dash through stages, but controlling separate characters with each hand will likely frustrate you.

This game is about overcoming that frustration and enjoying the sense of accomplishment when you succeed.

In this demo, you can play through four stages.

Enjoy improving your skills as you progress through each stage.

Playtime

Approximately 30 minutes

You can quickly experience the core of the game.

Character Control [/h]

Keyboard

  • Change direction for left hand: WASD

  • Jump for left hand: F

  • Dash for left hand: C

  • Change direction for right hand: OKL;

  • Jump for right hand: J

  • Dash for right hand: M

  • Open menu: ESC

Gamepad (Xbox)

  • Change direction for left hand: Left stick

  • Jump for left hand: Left trigger

  • Dash for left hand: Left bumper

  • Change direction for right hand: Right stick

  • Jump for right hand: Right trigger

  • Dash for right hand: Right bumper

  • Open menu: Y

fullgame.name: Hypotheses on the Symmetry between Vision and Hands

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: SteamOS 3
  • Processor: Zen 2 4c/8t、2.4-3.5GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 8 RDNA 2 CU、1.6GHz
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: SteamOS 3
  • Processor: Zen 2 4c/8t、2.4-3.5GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 8 RDNA 2 CU、1.6GHz
  • Storage: 1 GB available space

  • Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce RTX 2060
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: 64bitプロセッサー必須

  • OS: Windows 10

  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce RTX 2060
  • DirectX: Version 11

short_description: A brain "glitching" experience where you control the left hand with the left and the right hand with the right. We look forward to your participation.
supported_languages: English, Japanese, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese
